isis.stitle: ANTILOCK BRAKES/TRACTION CONTROL: BENDIX - PRINCIPLES, OPERATION AND SERVICE - MAINTENANCE - ANTILOCK RELAY VALVE

svcsubproc.title: General
svcsubproc.para: Perform the tests and inspections presented at the prescribed intervals. If the antilock relay valve fails to function as described, or leakage is excessive, it should be repaired or replaced. Use only International approved parts.

svcsubproc.title: Every 3 Months, 25,000 Miles Or 900 Operating Hours

step1.para: Remove any accumulated contaminants and visually inspect the exterior for excessive corrosion and physical damage.
Inspect all air lines connected to the relay valve for signs of wear or physical damage. Replace as necessary.
Test air line fittings for excessive leakage and tighten or replace as necessary.

svcsubproc.title: Every Year, 100,000 Miles, Or 3,600 Operating Hours
svcsubproc.para: Perform the Antilock Relay Valve Operation and Leakage Tests that follow.

step1.para: Apply and release the brakes several times while an observer is checking for prompt application and release at each wheel. If prompt reaction is noted at some, but not all wheels, test the modulator valve between the antilock relay valve and the brake actuator for proper operation. If a sluggish response is noted at all wheels, inspect for a kinked or obstructed air line leading to or from the antilock relay valve.
Build the air system pressure to governor cut-out, and apply a soap solution to the exhaust port in body. The leakage noted should not exceed a one-inch bubble in less than three seconds.

Make and hold a full brake application and apply a soap solution to the exhaust ports in the body, cover, and around the cover where it joins the body. The leakage noted should not exceed a one-inch bubble in less than three seconds at any exhaust port.
